Dear Kellie Rutledge:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
10/16/2025 . Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Nabiha Rizk, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CCI Rule 400.4104 Rules compliance
• (2) After being licensed, an institution shall, on an
ongoing basis, comply with the act, child caring
institution rules, and terms of the license.
The agency was not following the terms of their license. The agency is licensed as
a short-term shelter, and it was found the agency was also operating a long term
treatment program.
2

CCI Rule 400.4113 Employee records.
• (1)An institution shall maintain employee records for
each employee and shall include documentation of
all of the following information prior to employment
or at the time specified in this rule:
• (e) Three dated references which are
obtained prior to employment from persons
unrelated to the employee and which are less
than 12 months old.
Two of the six new employees were missing three references obtained prior to
employment from persons unrelated.
CCI Rule 400.4113 Employee records.
• (1)An institution shall maintain employee records for
each employee and shall include documentation of
all of the following information prior to employment
or at the time specified in this rule:
• (j) A written evaluation of the employee's
performance within 30 days of the completion
of the probationary period or within 180 days,
whichever is less, and a written evaluation of
the employee's performance annually
thereafter.
One of the six files reviewed was missing the annual performance evaluation.
CCI Rule 400.4128 Initial staff orientation and ongoing staff training.
• (3) The licensee shall document that each staff
person whose function is covered by these rules has
participated in a minimum of 50 clock hours of
planned training within the first year of employment
and a minimum of 25 clock hours of training annually
thereafter related to the employee's job function. At
least 16 of the 50 hours provided in the first year
shall be orientation provided prior to the assumption
of duties.
Two of six new employees' files did not contain documentation of at least 16 hours
of orientation prior to their assumption of duties.
3

CCI Rule 400.4144 Admission health screening; physical examinations.
• (1) An initial health screening shall be completed for
each resident within 24 hours of admission to a
facility.
One of the two current youth files was missing an initial health screen.
CCI Rule 400.4154 Shelter care and detention institutions; service
plans.
• (1) Within 30 calendar days after admission and
every 15 calendar days thereafter, an institution
shall complete a written service plan. The service
plan shall include all of the following:
• (a) The reason for continued care.
• (b) Evaluation of service needs.
• (c) Ongoing service needs.
• (d) How service needs will be met.
• (e) Unmet service needs and the reasons
those needs are unmet.
Two of the two current youths' files did not have the 30-day service plan
completed.
CCI Rule 400.4166 Discharge plan
• (1) When a resident is discharged from institutional
care, all of the following information shall be
documented in the case record within 14 days after
discharge
• (a) The date of and reason for discharge, and
the new location of the child.
One of the three youths' files reviewed was missing the date and reason for
discharge and their new location.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Technical assistance was offered on maintaining and organizing the employee/HR
files, as this should be separated by sections to assist with the audit process and
ensure compliance with the rule.
4

• Technical assistance was offered regarding the organizing of youths’ files;
specifically discharge forms to ensure they have all the paperwork filed in one
section to assist with the audit process.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation provided regarding the agency not accepting new youths into the treatment
program until the program statement, related policies where approved, and the terms of
the license were changed to include treatment care.
• Consultation provided regarding documentation for the treatment program to include
referral information upon admission, emergency/afterhours intake processes, length of
stay, discharge and service plan templates, processes and documentation for internal
transfers between programs and tracking document due dates and licensing compliance.
treatment care.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on a review of the facility’s budget
and the agency financial audit.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not Applicable
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was done on time and was comprehensive
and reviewed all areas of noncompliance from the previous licensing review. The
facility’s corrective action plan for their 2024 renewal report was implemented
however employee records continue to be an area where the agency struggles with
specifically reference checks and performance evaluation. The agency hired a new
director of employee experience to audit employee files and ensure rule
5

compliance. The agency is requesting to add a treatment program and submitted a
change application on 09/24/2025 and policies and procedures for the treatment
program.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviewed reported feeling very supported by management, having the
necessary training and tools to provide care and supervision for the youths in the
program and expressed no concerns regarding the agency.
Youths interviewed reported all their needs are being met, and they are attending
school. Youths expressed no concerns regarding the agency or staff.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency is on the second-floor building. It has a living room, dining room,
kitchen, the hallway leads to a short-term stay, it has 2 full bathrooms, and 6
bedrooms with a bed in each bedroom. The second section of the hallway leads to
two bedrooms with a total of three beds, one full bathroom, staff desk and
homework station. The facility is clean, neat, and appropriate. There were no
issues of concern noted.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
